snippet: After facing mounting criticism, the nonprofit organization, whose president is appointed by the mayor, pledged to make its financial information more accessible.
abstract: New York City's Economic Development Corporation pledges to make its operations more transparent after pressure from state Attorney General Eric T Schneiderman and city Comptroller John C Liu; EDC's annual contract renewal includes a pledge to make some financial information that is already in the public domain more accessible through the comptroller's Web site Checkbook NYC.
lead_paragraph: After facing mounting criticism, the nonprofit organization, whose president is appointed by the mayor, pledged to make its financial information more accessible.

headline.seo: New York City Economic Development Corporation Agrees to More Openness
